title: Identify the Structure
text: What does the equation $$6x^2+17x+5$$ look like? Hint: It's a quadratic equation in the standard form $${ax}^2+bx+c=0$$.

title: Factor the Equation
text: To solve by factoring, we need to find two numbers that multiply to give ac (where $$a=6$$ and $$c=5)$$ and add to give $$b$$ (where $$b=17)$$. What are those two numbers?

title: Rewrite Middle Term
text: Once you have the two numbers, rewrite the middle term (17x) as the sum of two terms using those numbers. What does the equation look like now?

title: Factor by Grouping
text: Now group the terms into pairs and factor out the greatest common factor from each pair. What expression do you get by factoring out?

title: Set Each Factor to Zero
text: After factoring, you'll have a product of two binomials. How do you solve the equation $$factor factor=0$$?

title: Solve for $$x$$
text: Finally, solve each simpler equation from the previous step to find the values of $$x$$.
